title.rendered: Valiant Driller jack-up completes move from Indonesia to India

content.rendered:
Via Energy Global

AqualisBraemar, part of Oslo-listed Aqualis ASA, has completed the marine warranty services for the dry transportation of the mobile offshore drilling unit Valiant Driller jack-up from Indonesia to India, where it will operate for ONGC.

Valiant Driller, owned by Jackup Drilling Pte. Ltd, was transported from Indonesia on the COSCO heavy lift vessel Xian Yun kou, following a well-executed float-on operation at the Port of Batu Ampar, Batam, Indonesia. After the heavy lift vessel safely reached India, the rig was wet towed to a platform drilling location at the Mumbai High oilfield, offshore the west coast of India.

Marine warranty surveyor duty

AqualisBraemar was appointed as marine warranty surveyor on behalf of the rig owner, and supported the operation throughout by conducting independent reviews of the engineering, marine procedures and on-site approvals of marine activities. The rig move was managed by AqualisBraemar’s office in Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

“This was an important move for us as Valiant Driller is a new jack-up drilling rig coming to India to work for ONGC. We are pleased to announce that it was conducted safely and on time using the well appointed Xian Yun Kou heavy lift vessel,” says Captain Rodger Dickson, Marine Director – Middle East, AqualisBraemar.
Adapted from press release by Cecilia Rehn

Published on 31/03/2015

jetpack-related-posts.title: Successful rig move during Indian Covid-19 lockdown
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar has supported the successful rig move of jack-up rig Sagar Ratna from Pipavav dry dock to her monsoon drilling location.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar reaches rig move milestone
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar marked attendance on its 2,000th mobile offshore unit rig move when the Deep Driller 8 jack-up rig was positioned a few days ago at an offshore wellhead platform on the east coast of India.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Despite Covid-19, ONGC successfully moves 33 drilling rigs in pre-monsoon rush
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Despite severe constraints caused by the Covid-19 lockdown in India, Oil and Natural Gas Corporation Limited (ONGC) has safely and successfully moved a total of 33 offshore jack-up rigs to new drilling locations ahead of the adverse weather conditions associated with the Indian monsoon season.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Meet the Team: Capt. Sandeep Sharma
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: “I handle the country operations for India, whereby my role entails me to liaise with clients and partners to reach newer heights.”

jetpack-related-posts.title: Indian extension for AqualisBraemar
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 25 May 2016 – United India Insurance Company has reappointed AqualisBraemar to provide marine warranty services to the Oil and Natural Gas Corporation Limited’s (ONGC) assets offshore India. This is the third one-year contract AqualisBraemar has received after the company first started working for United India Insurance Company and ONGC…

jetpack-related-posts.title: New head of Middle East for Aqualis
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 30 August 2016 – Marine and offshore engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar has appointed Ben Lazenby as director of the company’s Middle East operation, which now counts five offices in four different countries. Ben Lazenby succeeds Reuben Segal, who will now concentrate fully on his role as Chief Operating Officer of AqualisBraemar.…
